item.title: recommend me a series
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Speaking of series, the Swedish TV miniseries extended cut of the “Dragon Tattoo Trilogy” finally got a US blu ray. I just mainlined all three extended cuts- they’re very, VERY good. “Played with Fire” in particular was much more comprehensible with the added scenes.

Dr. Strangelove:

Not really.

I like it. It’s different from a lot of the haunted house movies/shows, I’m not going to tell you why though. I think it’s really interesting. I’d suggest watching the first episode or two and seeing yourself.

item.title: recommend me a series
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
bur:

yeah, seen it, it’s pretty awesome

especially mulder

Well then watch Fringe.

Also if you’re into mindfuck plots and kickass visuals, Aeon Flux is a good place to start… Had a real Deus Ex feel to it… or was it the other way around? Yep. The Ion Storm guys were definitely watching Aeon Flux. Again, if you skipped childhood Samuri Jack is a good thing to revisit. imo, the show has risen over age group classification. It’s just good, bro.

item.title: recommend me a series
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
That list reminds me to recommend Twin Peaks.

Basically, before the first episode, Laura Palmer is murdered, each episode is one day, and the series is the weeks after her death. It gets pretty weird and pretty awesome. The movie (Fire Walk With Me) is a prequel and will spoil the series for you, so if you’re going to watch it, watch it after. It shows the events leading up to Laura Palmer’s murder, and IMO feels rushed. Probably because the show takes it’s time to tell it’s story.

The text in my sig is a quote from Twin Peaks.

Read full topic

item.title: recommend me a series
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Archer, since the titular character is one of the funniest I’ve ever seen in a TV show. He’s such an asshole that it’s worth watching just to hear what he has to say.

And also LOST, it’s such a great series, not only does it have great characters that you really get attached to, but it also has this great story that, in the end, comes to a satisfying conclusion which answers all of the biggest questions, while leaving room for continued theorizing on your part. That’s something I don’t see a lot anymore. Nowadays, it’s like the entertainment industry needs to hold the viewer’s hand, but LOST allows the viewer to think and wonder, to hypothesize and theorize…I would encourage you to watch it with a friend, if only for the resultant discussions and debates that WILL be spawned.

And as I’ve said before, the characters are simply remarkable. I have yet to see another series where the the characters entranced me so. Wonderfully written characters played by masterful actors and actresses.

EDIT: And give Boardwalk Empire go, it’s fucking brilliant. It’s smart, it’s based on real shit that happened, most of the characters actually existed (and acted how they are portrayed on screen), and Steve Buscemi is so freaking talented.

Read full topic
